result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard C Murphy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: The $550.00 owed to FC Drug Task Force is to be paid thru probation first and within the first 6 months of probation.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any taverns/bars.

The defendant must continue with treatment in Veterans Program and follow thru with recommended treatment.

The defendant must undergo psychological evaluation and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: The community service can be completed thru Veteran's Program.

03:47 PM Defendant Leonard C Murphy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. P&P Agent Nick Nooyen is appearing telephonically with leave of the Court. Court has concern with the departments request to turn any unpaid fines into civil judgement when no effort has been made to pay the fines, why not extend probation to get fines taken care of. Agency did send a memo to the Court in regards to this. Court has memo in it's possession. Court will grant the request and enter civil judgment for the unpaid fines.

records.addlTxt: Called at 2:11 PM. Leonard Murphy appears in person and with counsel Henry Schultz. State appears by Charles Simono. State - resolved - plead G to counts #1 and #3 as alleged, remaining counts DRI, withhold sentence and place on probation for 4 years with conditions of: continued AODA, 300 hours of community  service, psychological assessment if needed, pay $550.00 as a cost to FC Drug Task Force (stipulated). Schultz and Murphy agree and Schultz has things to add regarding agreement. Murphy pleads G to counts #1 and #3 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #4, #5, #6, #7, #8, and #9. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Schultz makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Murphy makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 4 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, 300 hours of community service (one count only) - OK if done thru work in Veterans Program, undergo psychological evalaution and followo thru, pay $550.00 as a cost on one count to FC Drug Task Force - paid thru probation first and within first 6 months of probation, continue in treatment in Veterans Program and follow thru with recommended treatment, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, submit DNA sample with surcharge assessed - paid thru probation, costs on count #3 including DNA surcharge - paid thru probation, no voting rights, no possession of firearms, right to appeal, adjourned.
Regarding Bail Bond Conditions
LCM
Final pre-trial on December 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
state
Mirrors complaint.

To signature bond.

Called 10:16 AM Defendant Leonard C Murphy in court and in custody with attorney Henry Reid Schultz. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has filed information which mirrors the complaint and believes defendant will be waiving preliminary hearing. Murphy waives his right to preliminary hearing, court goes over waiver form and finds defendant has freely, voluntarly and intellegently waived preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Proceed to arraignment. Schultz has Information and waives further reading, enters NG pleas. Set for FPT. Bond - Schultz court had previously stated consider modification of bond at preliminary hearing. Schultz - asks for reduction of bond. State - no objections for reduction of bond but would like to see defendant get into treatment facility. Court amends cash bond down to $10,000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 10, 2014 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Leonard C Murphy
Current: 617 Watson Street, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 09-03-2014)

Called at 10:17 AM. Leonard Murphy appears via video from FOSO and with counsel Henry Schultz also appearing via video from FOSO. State appears by Charles Simono. Schultz has complaint, waives reading, wants a PH and wishes to address bond. Schultz - bond - asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons. State -bond - objects to any reduction in bond for stated reasons. Schultz responds - current address is 617 Watson Street in Antigo, WI. Court asks status of probation revocation. Schultz responds - pursuiting ATR - hearing is 9/30/14 in Forest County. Court - bond - reduces bond to $5000.00 signature bond with same conditions. Court now continues bond and sets for PH on 9/10/14 at 10:30 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 3, 2014 at 10:15 am.

Called at 10:31 AM. Leonard Murphy appears via video from FOSO and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Murphy does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Murphy does not understand charges and penalties. Court responds. Murphy states that he has hired Henry Schultz. Clerk clarifies that this case was not properly noticed for today. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 9/3/14 at 10:15 PM and instructed to let Mr. Schultz know of new date and time.
No consumption of alcohol
cash
